snippet: Stefan Matteau, 18, scored his first goal and Martin Brodeur played in his 1,200th regular-season game as the Devils ended the Penguins’ five-game winning streak to move into first in the Atlantic Division.
abstract: NHL Roundup; New Jersey Devils defeat Pittsburgh Penguins, 3-1; Devils winger Stefan Matteau records his first career NHL goal, while goaltender Martin Brodeur plays in his 1,200th regular-season game; other hockey scores noted.
lead_paragraph: Stefan Matteau, 18, scored his first goal and Martin Brodeur played in his 1,200th regular-season game as the Devils ended the Penguins’ five-game winning streak to move into first in the Atlantic Division.

headline.seo: Milestones for Stefan Matteau and Martin Brodeur as Devils End Penguins’ Winning Streak
headline.main: Milestones for Matteau and Brodeur and a Big Win for the Devils
headline.print_headline: This Time, Matteau Goal Lifts Devils
